text: ਕਿਉ ਨ ਮਰੀਜੈ ਰੋਇ ਜਾ ਲਗੁ ਚਿਤਿ ਨ ਆਵਹੀ ॥੧॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: I might as well just die crying, if You will not come into my mind. ||1||

transliteration.text: kiu n marījai rōi jā lag chit n āvahī .1.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Guru Angad Dev
author.description:
Guru Angad Dev [1504 - 1552], originally called Bhai Lehna, was born at Harike, a small village in the Ferozepur district. His father was named Pheru and worked as a small businessman.

Bhai Lehna always did everything that Guru Nanak asked, which is why Guru Nanak renamed Bhai Lehna as his Ang or limb of his body.

Guru Angad Dev simplified the old Punjabi characters into a new alphabet, called Gurmukhi. He thus gave the people the gift of literature. He took great interest in the education of children and opened several schools.

section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: Second Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਜਾਂ ਸੁਖੁ ਤਾ ਸਹੁ ਰਾਵਿਓ ਦੁਖਿ ਭੀ ਸੰਮ੍ਹਾਲਿਓਇ ॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: When there is peace and pleasure, that is the time to remember your Husband Lord. In times of suffering and pain, remember Him then as well.

transliteration.text: jānh sukh tā sah rāviō dukh bhī sanmhāliōi .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਕਹੈ ਸਿਆਣੀਏ ਇਉ ਕੰਤ ਮਿਲਾਵਾ ਹੋਇ ॥੨॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: Says Nanak, O wise bride, this is the way to meet your Husband Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: nānak kahai siānīē iu kant milāvā hōi .2.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਹਉ ਕਿਆ ਸਾਲਾਹੀ ਕਿਰਮ ਜੰਤੁ ਵਡੀ ਤੇਰੀ ਵਡਿਆਈ ॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: I am a worm - how can I praise You, O Lord; Your glorious greatness is so great!

transliteration.text: hau kiā sālāhī kiram jant vadī tērī vadiāī .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਤੂ ਅਗਮ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਅਗੰਮੁ ਹੈ ਆਪਿ ਲੈਹਿ ਮਿਲਾਈ ॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: You are inaccessible, merciful and unapproachable; You Yourself unite us with Yourself.

transliteration.text: tū agam daiāl aganm hai āp laih milāī .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਮੈ ਤੁਝ ਬਿਨੁ ਬੇਲੀ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਤੂ ਅੰਤਿ ਸਖਾਈ ॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: I have no other friend except You; in the end, You alone will be my Companion and Support.

transliteration.text: mai tujh bin bēlī kō nahī tū ant sakhāī .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਜੋ ਤੇਰੀ ਸਰਣਾਗਤੀ ਤਿਨ ਲੈਹਿ ਛਡਾਈ ॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: You save those who enter Your Sanctuary.

transliteration.text: jō tērī saranāgatī tin laih shadāī .

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਵੇਪਰਵਾਹੁ ਹੈ ਤਿਸੁ ਤਿਲੁ ਨ ਤਮਾਈ ॥੨੦॥੧॥
section: Suhi - Vaar Suhi Ki

translation.text: O Nanak, He is care-free; He has no greed at all. ||20||1||

transliteration.text: nānak vēparavāh hai tis til n tamāī .20.1.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਰਾਗੁ ਸੂਹੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀਉ ਤਥਾ ਸਭਨਾ ਭਗਤਾ ਕੀ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Soohee, The Word Of Kabeer Jee, And Other Devotees.

transliteration.text: rāg sūhī bānī srī kabīr jīu tathā sabhanā bhagatā kī .

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Since your birth, what have you done?

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਰਾਮ ਕੋ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਕਬਹੂ ਲੀਨਾ ॥੧॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You have never even chanted the Name of the Lord. ||1||

transliteration.text: rām kō nām n kabahū līnā .1.

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

text: ਰਾਮ ਨ ਜਪਹੁ ਕਵਨ ਮਤਿ ਲਾਗੇ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You have not meditated on the Lord; what thoughts are you attached to?

transliteration.text: rām n japah kavan mat lāgē .

text: ਮਰਿ ਜਇਬੇ ਕਉ ਕਿਆ ਕਰਹੁ ਅਭਾਗੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: What preparations are you making for your death, O unfortunate one? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: mar jaibē kau kiā karah abhāgē .1. rahāu .

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Through pain and pleasure, you have taken care of your family.

transliteration.text: dukh sukh kar kai kutanb jīvāiā .

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I decorate myself like a young virgin;

melody.description: Suhi is an expression of such devotion that the listener experiences feelings of extreme closeness and undying love. The listener is bathed in that love and genuinely comes to know what it means to adore.

translation.text: Says Kabeer, this is the way the story of my life ends. ||4||2||

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Soohee, Kabeer Jee:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Your time of service is at its end, and you will have to give your account.

text: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਜਾ ਕਉ ਹਰਿ ਰੰਗੁ ਲਾਗਾ ॥ ਧਨੁ ਧਨੁ ਸੋ ਜਨੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਭਾਗਾ ॥
section: Suhi - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Blessed, blessed is the most fortunate servant of the Lord, who is imbued with the Lord's Love, in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy.

transliteration.text: sādhasang jā kau har rang lāgā . dhan dhan sō jan purakh sabhāgā .
